# Waveform Generation Example
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Generate a signal
t = np.linspace(0, 1, 500)
f = 5  # Frequency in Hz
signal = np.sin(2 * np.pi * f * t)

print(f'Generating a {f}Hz sine wave...')

# Plot the signal
plt.figure(figsize=(6, 4))
plt.plot(t, signal)
plt.title('5Hz Sine Wave')
plt.xlabel('Time [s]')
plt.ylabel('Amplitude')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

# FFT Visualization Example
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Parameters
fs = 1000
t = np.linspace(0, 1, fs, endpoint=False)

# Generate signal with 5Hz and 20Hz components
sig = 0.5 * np.sin(2 * np.pi * 5 * t) + 0.3 * np.sin(2 * np.pi * 20 * t)

# Compute FFT
fft_vals = np.fft.fft(sig)
fft_freq = np.fft.fftfreq(len(sig), 1/fs)

print('Computed FFT of the composite signal.')

# Plot
plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))

plt.subplot(2, 1, 1)
plt.plot(t, sig)
plt.title('Time Domain Signal')
plt.xlabel('Time (s)')
plt.ylabel('Amplitude')
plt.grid(True)

plt.subplot(2, 1, 2)
# Plot only positive frequencies
mask = fft_freq > 0
plt.plot(fft_freq[mask], np.abs(fft_vals[mask]), color='orange')
plt.title('Frequency Domain (FFT)')
plt.xlabel('Frequency (Hz)')
plt.ylabel('Magnitude')
plt.xlim(0, 50)
plt.grid(True)

plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Room Impulse Response (RIR) Simulation
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Parameters
fs = 16000
duration = 0.5
t = np.linspace(0, duration, int(fs*duration))

# Schroeder Model: Exponential decay
RT60 = 0.3 # Reverberation time in seconds
decay = np.exp(-6.9 * t / RT60)

# Generate noise carrier
noise = np.random.normal(0, 1, len(t))

# Apply decay envelope
rir = decay * noise

print(f'Simulating Room Impulse Response with RT60={RT60}s')

# Plot
plt.figure(figsize=(6, 4))
plt.plot(t, rir, color='gray', alpha=0.6, label='Response')
plt.plot(t, decay, 'r--', linewidth=2, label='Envelope')
plt.title('Simulated Room Impulse Response')
plt.xlabel('Time (s)')
plt.ylabel('Amplitude')
plt.legend()
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

# Source Directivity Visualization
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Angle vector
theta = np.linspace(0, 2*np.pi, 200)

# Cardioid pattern equation: (1 + cos(theta)) / 2
r = (1 + np.cos(theta)) / 2

print('Visualizing Cardioid Source Directivity')

# Polar Plot
plt.figure(figsize=(5, 5))
ax = plt.subplot(111, projection='polar')
ax.plot(theta, r, color='blue', linewidth=2)
ax.fill(theta, r, alpha=0.25)
ax.set_title('Directivity Pattern (Cardioid)', pad=20)
ax.set_rticks([0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()
